revised_title: Electromotive Force Variations in Fused Salts: A Study of Temperature Effects
tldr: This study investigates the variations of electromotive force between metals at high temperatures in fused salts, focusing on the effects of temperature differences on the direction and magnitude of the current. The research demonstrates that temperature divergence between metals plays a significant role in reversing the electromotive force, and explores the relationship between thermal effects and the normal electrochemical action of fused salts.
